instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
Dead USB Port A not B, mistyped. :/

It is receiving power okay.

Board looks like it may have been water damaged but customer claims it just stopped working.

I have a Boardview but no schematic for this one, so some guidance would be appreciated.

Where should I start?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message: Measure on diode mode both pins of L4600. Corrosion around U4650 is common too.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
L4600::Pin1 == 0.487
L4600::Pin4 == 0.491

L4600::Pin2 & Pin 3 == OL.

U4650 looks spotless. The whole board is really clean if it weren't for redish probe points.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message: Uhm, do I need to tell you L4600 is bad?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
haha.

Sorry, I wasn't paying attention.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
I need a part number if possible please.

I can't find a schematic so I'm doing this all off only a boardview.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
No Title

just take it from a donor board...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3330 USB_B Dead, but has 5v.
threads.message:
Thanks for the screen shot.

I took the part from a 3115 board and she booted straight off the USB_A. :)

I'll try mark this post as SOLVED, but maybe a moderator can if they see this.

Thanks to dukefawks too!
